reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Program Continuation Grant for Scaling Up Malaria Control Interventions Towards Universal Coverage in Sierra Leone

description.narrative: Sierra Leone - Malaria - Catholic Relief Services - United States Conference of Catholic Bishops - CRS Sierra Leone. This program has the following goals: By 2020, reduce malaria morbidity and mortality by at least 40% compared with 2015.. The objectives of this program are: All suspected malaria cases should have access to confirmatory diagnosis. All malaria cases to receive effective treatment.. Provide access to 100% of the population at risk with preventive measures by 2017. To protect at least 80 % of pregnant women and children under one year with IPT 3 by 2020. To provide knowledge to the population such that at least 80% practise malaria prevention and treatment measures by 2018.. By 2020, at least 95% of health facilities report routinely on malaria programme performance.. By 2020, maintain and strengthen capacity for program management, coordination and partnership to achieve malaria programme performance at all levels.

Coverage / Output indicator for SLE-M-CRS
Proportion of health facilities without stock-outs of key commodities during the reporting period
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of malaria cases (presumed and confirmed) that received first line antimalarial treatment at public sector health facilities
Proportion of confirmed malaria cases that received first-line antimalarial treatment in the community
HSS-Other 1: Number of functional community health clubs mobilized to deliver BCC outreach activities
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test at public sector health facilities
Proportion of suspected malaria cases that receive a parasitological test in the community
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to targeted risk groups through continuous distribution
Number of long-lasting insecticidal nets distributed to at-risk populations through mass campaigns
HSS-Other 2: Number of functional school health clubs mobilized to deliver BCC outreach activities
HSS-Other 3: Number of people in the community reached through sensitization activities (CHCs)
Proportion of pregnant women attending antenatal clinics who received three or more doses of intermittent preventive treatment for malaria
Proportion of children under five with fever with whom the caretakers sought prompt care within 24 hours at the community level
Proportion of people who recall hearing or seeing a messages on malaria prevention and control within the last six months
HSS-Other 4: Number of in-school youths reached through sensitization activities (SHCs)
